definition: to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: I've been working on forehands and volleys.
sentences.chinese: 我已經對正手和截擊做了改進。

sentences.english: He returned the ball on the volley.
In this way, many difficulties experienced while carrying out a night interception are hoped to be successfully overcome.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，執行夜間截擊的困難就有希望被成功克服。

sentences.english: Mirnyi's powerful serve and volley game proved ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 米爾尼的強力發球和網前截擊顯得並不十分有效。

sentences.english: Q. Just his volleying in general.
sentences.chinese: 不，就是整個截擊的表現。

sentences.english: He's good at volleying it back to his opponent .
sentences.chinese: 他擅長於截擊球來反擊他的對手。

sentences.english: But he came up with some good volleys and big serves, and that is what happened.
sentences.chinese: 但是他有很好的截擊和發球，這就是場上所發生的。

sentences.english: Nonda slipped Boulahrouz's attempted interception, and raced for the area with Terry holding off to cover McCarthy.
sentences.chinese: 農達帶球越過博拉魯茲的截擊，進入的防區。

sentences.english: You volleyed it back too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 你截擊球的動作太快了。

sentences.english: Series of attacks blamed on people with grievances, mental illness
sentences.chinese: 一連串的截擊歸罪於具有不滿情緒和心理疾病的人。

sentences.english: His timing when he volleys is so good.
sentences.chinese: 他截擊空中球的時機掌握得很好。

sentences.english: No. I mean, he came up with some good volleys.
sentences.chinese: 不，我的意思是他的確有一些好的截擊。

sentences.english: In the beginning , he missed a few volleys to help me out .
sentences.chinese: 一開始，他錯過一些截擊，這幫我得分。

definition: to evacuate (e.g. foreign civilians from a war zone)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
to join an alliance/admission to the United Nations
to open fire/to shoot a gun
